decision_conditions: <p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">The application fails to accurately depict the extent of proposed development indicated on the plans provided, which demonstrate that the development would involve&nbsp;works to&nbsp;the neighbouring roof form which falls outside of the application site. The works could prejudice third parties who may otherwise wish to comment on the application, and as such the works are contrary to:</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11pt">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;</span>The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>

<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed development, by reason of its siting, scale, design and proximity to neighbours, would result in an undue loss of daylight/sunlight, outlook, and privacy, and an undue sense of overbearingness&nbsp;to neighbours properties at nos. 91, 95, 97 and&nbsp;99&nbsp;Goresbrook Road. The proposal represents an unneighbourly form of development, and is contrary to: </span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021) </span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010) </span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>

<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed development, by reason of its inappropriate fenestration details and arrangement, protruding first floor extension and incongruous first floor balcony, represents a disjointed addition which fails to respect the character and appearance of the host property, adjoining terrace and surrounding area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</span></p><div><p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</span></span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- Policy CP3 of the </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of </span>The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p></div>
